newsitem.title: TURKEY: TURK KOC YATIRIM TO MERGE INTO PARENT FIRM KOC HLD.
newsitem.headline: TURK KOC YATIRIM TO MERGE INTO PARENT FIRM KOC HLD.

text.p: Turkey's leading industrial conglomerate Koc Holding A.S. and its investment arm Koc Yatirim ve Sanayi Mamulleri Pazarlama A.S. have begun moves towards a merger of Koc Yatirim into Koc Holding, the firms said in statements sent to the Istanbul Stock Exchange.
They said Koc Holding's capital which stands at 10 trillion lira, would go up by 683.7 billion lira after the merger to be based on the end-1996 balance sheet of Koc Yatirim.
Koc Yatirim shareholders, except Koc Holding, are to receive a 1.28288 Koc Holding share in return for each 1,000 lira nominal-valued Koc Yatirim share.
Koc Holding holds a 34.93 percent stake in Koc Yatirim's 819 billion lira capital.
The merger was planned earlier this year as a result of Koc Yatirim's narrowing fields of activity, a need to increase efficiency and productivity in portfolio management and to reduce expenses.

The merger process will be supervised by a commerce court and be approved at extraordinary shareholder meetings of both companies. Permission must also be secured from Turkey's regulatory Capital Markets Board and the Industry and Trade Ministry.
Koc Holding shares were down 500 lira at 27,500 lira on the Istanbul stock market at midday on Friday while Koc Yatirim shares gained 2,000 lira to 32,500.
